meanings.definition: Relating to the ancient Greek god Dionysus or his worship.
meanings.sent1: The dionysiac festival honored Dionysus with music and dance.
meanings.sent2: The scholars studied the dionysiac rituals of ancient Greece.
meanings.sent3: The dionysiac celebration had everyone wearing grapevine wreaths.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, a dionysiac joy.
meanings.sent5: The dionysiac procession was a colorful spectacle of revelry.

meanings.definition: Wild, frenzied, or unrestrained in behavior.
meanings.sent1: The dionysiac crowd cheered wildly at the concert.
meanings.sent2: After the game, the fans displayed dionysiac excitement.
meanings.sent3: The dionysiac party went on until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent4: His dionysiac energy on the dance floor was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The storm unleashed a dionysiac fury upon the landscape.
